summary: 'Jon Snow As Jesus' Image Could Land Russian Student In Prison
title: 'Jon Snow As Jesus' Image Could Land Russian Student In Prison
excerpt: Russia has already convicted a blogger for mocking Christianity with Pokemon Go. Now a Russian student is facing potential prison time for a meme likening Jesus Christ to a character in the massively popular television show Game Of Thrones.
description:
In Russia it is generally a crime to criticize religion or use it in satire. It appears that Russian law enforcement agencies have been looking for irreverent posts at VKontakte.

In the later years of the USSR, Vladimir Putin was an agent of the KGB which helped the officially atheistic state to repress religion, including the Orthodox Church.

But now President Putin is attempting to boost his support among conservative elements of society. So instead of repressing religion, he is groveling to the demands of religious leaders. The results are draconian laws which forbid the disparagement of religion and of the Orthodox Church in particular.

There is hypocrisy in the prosecution of Daniil Markin. It is apparently illegal to compare Jon Snow to Jesus; but it is perfectly acceptable to worship Vladimir Putin as if he were a saint. You can even buy a religious icon of Saint Putin for only 600 rubles [US $9.60 / UK £7.30].

Владетель Путин, услышь наши молитвы!

summary: How can you kill a dragon? In Game of Thrones and in mythology
title: How can you kill a dragon? In Game of Thrones and in mythology
body:
How can you kill a dragon? In Game of Thrones and in mythology

Let’s face it, even though we love the dragons in ‘Game of Thrones’, there was a good chance that at least one of them would bite the dust in season 7 and, if not, it was in the eighth season. Poor Viseryon.

We knew that they were not easy to defeat, of course. The dragons were and are notoriously difficult to kill, and those who attempt it rarely receive more than one shot before being roasted…

View On WordPress

blog.description: Sideblog for discussing not just A Song of Ice and Fire, but also  general medieval material history and culture. | My interests include dynastic politics, spreadsheets, and seeing my enemies driven before me.So, basically, I really fucking love Crusader Kings 2. | I hate on Show!Dany because I'm a huge fan of Book!Dany.

summary: I have absolutely no stake in the shipping wars, but
title: I have absolutely no stake in the shipping wars, but
body:
if you think Dany would be remotely interested in Jon (at least at first), I’m not sure we’re reading the same books.

Don’t get me wrong, Jon’s a right good lad and all, but that’s kinda the problem. Dany doesn’t like right good lads. She likes bad boys, and would eat that poor dork apart.

Daario’s swords have some sexy naked ladies on the grips. Jon’s sword pommel features his pet dog.

reblog.comment:

summary: Jonerys 1940’s AU. (Truthfully i don’t even know what this is my hand just got carried away with what started out as a simple...
caption:
Jonerys 1940’s AU. (Truthfully i don’t even know what this is my hand just got carried away with what started out as a simple sketch)

Don’t get too caught up in how OOC this all looks… i mean it is an AU. I’m just kind of rolling with your typical high class rich girl meets low class (bastard status) coal miner type of guy (aka: forbidden romance) story (a sort of Rose/Jack thing but in the 40’s). Anyways i’m weird. I’ll shut it now. 🤐
